sources.title: "A Drunkard's Reformation" (1909) director D. W. Griffith starring Arthur V. Johnson
sources.description: This gem is presented by Silent Hall of Fame.   Please visit https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/   to support our non-profit mission and the legacy of silent movie stars by making a tax deductible contribution.   FEEL FREE TO FOLLOW US ON TWITTER @SilentFilmGems   "A Drunkard's Reformation" is a short drama.  The film is included in our program to illustrate the work of three of our stars: actress Florence Lawrence, actor Arthur Johnson and cinematographer Billy Bitzer.  Our star Robert Harron has a small role as a theater usher. Directed by                       D.W. Griffith Cinematography by         Billy Bitzer Starring                             Arthur V. Johnson, Florence Lawrence Distributed by                   Biograph Company Release date                      April 1, 1909 Country                             United States Running time                    9 m. metadata.Plot: A drinking man arrives home, late and sozzled as usual. His wife reminds him that he promised to take their child to a play. The play proves to be a morality tale about the evils of drink; he sees the parallels in his own life and swears off the demon brew.
metadata.Actors: Arthur V. Johnson, Linda Arvidson, Adele DeGarde
